component:ember-caluma/components/cf-con.title: CfContentComponent
component:ember-caluma/components/cf-con.text:
Component to render a form with navigation. This component can either be used the default way: {{cf-content documentId="some-id"}} Or it can be customized {{#cf-content documentId="some-id" as |content|}}
{{content.navigation}}
{{content.form}}
{{/cf-content}}

attributes.name: CfContentComponent
attributes.description:
Component to render a form with navigation.

This component can either be used the default way:

{{cf-content documentId="some-id"}}

Or it can be customized

{{#cf-content documentId="some-id" as |content|}}
  <div uk-grid>
    <div class="uk-width-1-2">{{content.navigation}}</div>
    <div class="uk-width-1-2">{{content.form}}</div>
  </div>
{{/cf-content}}

fields.name: linkSlug
fields.description: Determines if the slug is "linked" to the question label, i.e. follows it's updates

arguments.name: documentId
arguments.description: The ID of the nested document to display the navigation for

arguments.name: context
arguments.description: Can be used to pass "context" information from the outside through to custom overrides.

arguments.name: section
arguments.description: Form slug of currently visible section

arguments.name: subSection
arguments.description: Form slug of currently visible sub-section

arguments.name: disabled
arguments.description: Whether the form renders in disabled state

component:ember-caluma/components/cf-fie.title: CfFieldComponent
component:ember-caluma/components/cf-fie.text: Component to display a label and input for a certain field of a document. {{cf-field field=someField}} You can disable the field by passing disabled=true.

attributes.name: CfFieldComponent
attributes.description:
Component to display a label and input for a certain field of a document.

{{cf-field field=someField}}

You can disable the field by passing disabled=true.

methods.name: save
methods.description: Task to save a field. This will set the passed value to the answer and save the field to the API after a timeout off 500 milliseconds.

attributes.description: Component for wrapping the input components

methods.name: toggle
methods.description: Toggle the checked state of an option and trigger saving the field.

params.name: slug
params.description: The slug of the changed option

params.name: checked
params.description: Whether the options checkbox is checked or not

returns.description: A promise resolving or rejecting with the event.

tags.name: babel
tags.value:
/polyfill@^7.4.0 is supposed to include "flat", but that doesn't work of us -
presumably because transitive dependencies still include babel 6 and the
corresponding babel-polyfill package. So we include this "manual" polyfill for now.

https://github.com/babel/babel/issues/9749

component:ember-caluma/components/cf-for.title: CfFormComponent
component:ember-caluma/components/cf-for.text: Component to display a form for a whole document. {{cf-form documentId="the-id-of-your-document"}}

attributes.name: CfFormComponent
attributes.description:
Component to display a form for a whole document.

{{cf-form documentId="the-id-of-your-document"}}

accessors.description: Transform raw data into document object

arguments.name: documentId
arguments.description: The ID of the document to display

arguments.name: disabled
arguments.description: Allows the whole form to be disabled.

arguments.name: overrides
arguments.description:
A hash containg mappings for widget overrides. Set the key of the hash to the slug of the question and the value to the Ember component.

{{cf-form
  documentId="the-id-of-your-document"
  overrides=(hash foo=(component "bar"))
}}

arguments.name: overrides
arguments.description: Can be used to pass "context" information from the outside through to custom overrides.

functions.name: getWidget
functions.description:
Helper for getting the right widget for a field.

This helper expects a field as first positional parameter. It checks if the field has a widget override in it's metadata. If one exists it checks if said widget was registered in the caluma options service and then returns the widget name.

{{component (get-widget field default="cf-form") foo=bar}}

functions.name: lastValue
functions.description: Shortcut to read the last successful value of a task

functions.name: getAST
functions.description: Transform a JEXL expression into it's AST

functions.name: traverseTransforms
functions.description: Generator to walk down a JEXL AST tree and yield all transforms

params.name: tree
params.description: The JEXL AST tree or branch

functions.name: getTransforms
functions.description: Get all transforms in a JEXL AST tree

params.name: tree
params.description: The JEXL AST tree or branch

template:application-tailwind.title: Your Tailwind styles
template:application-tailwind.text: Your Tailwind styles A reference for every generated class in your app.

template:docs/index.title: Installation
template:docs/index.text: Installation ember install ember-caluma Usage To make ember-caluma work a few steps must be followed. The form builder is a routable engine which must be mounted in app/router.js: To make ember-apollo-client work, we need to pass it as dependency for our engine in app/app.js. Additionally, we need to specify ember-intl as a dependency so that the the application has access to the addon's translations. Also, since our form builder needs to customize the apollo service in order to support fragments on unions and interfaces, create a new service app/services/apollo.js and extend the apollo service with the provided mixin: Last but not least import ember-uikit and ember-caluma to apply styling in app/styles/app.scss: The $modal-z-index variable is needed to keep the ember-power-select dropdown above modal dialogs as the default of z-index of 1010 (intentionally) dwarfs all other indexes.

template:docs/testing.title: Testing
template:docs/testing.text: Testing Per default, ember-caluma exposes models and factories for ember-cli-mirage (if it is installed) into the host app. To use those factories you need to install mirage and faker. $ ember install ember-cli-mirage $ yarn add -D faker ember-auto-importNow you should be able to use the graphql endpoint in your test setup. To do so add the following lines to your mirage/config.js: // mirage/config.js import graphqlHandler from "ember-caluma/mirage-graphql"; export default function() { // ... this.post("/graphql", graphqlHandler(this), 200); }You can also generate all of the models ember-caluma provides in your test setup: // available models are: answer, case, document, file, form, option, question, // task and work-item server.create("form"); server.createList("question", 10);If you don't want to use the mirage setup for caluma in your host app you can simply disable it in the options: // ember-cli-build.js module.exports = function(defaults) { let app = new EmberApp(defaults, { // .. "ember-caluma": { includeMirageConfig: false } }); // .. };
